com.viaoa.util

Class OAFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.File
      • com.viaoa.util.OAFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.io.File>

    public class OAFile
extends java.io.File
    Subclass of java.io.File that includes extra functionality.

    Note: All file names separators will automatically be converted to match the Operating System.

    See Also:
    OAString.convertFileName(java.lang.String), Serialized Form

      • mkdirsForFile

        public static void mkdirsForFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Create directories for fileName.
        Compared to the method in the File.class, "File.mkdirs()" which creates a directory using the full fileName, where fileName itself will end up being a directory. This method assumes that the fileName is for a file and will then create the directories needed so that the file can be saved.

      • mkdirsForFile

        public static void mkdirsForFile(java.io.File file)

      • renameTo

        public void renameTo(java.lang.String fileName)
        Renames this file to another name. This will create the required directories for the new file.

      • copy

        public static void copy(java.lang.String fileNameFrom,
        java.lang.String fileNameTo)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Copy a file to another file. This will create the required directories for the new file.

        NOTE: if the fileNameTo already exists, it will be overwritten.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • copyResourceToFile

        public static boolean copyResourceToFile(java.lang.Class c,
                         java.lang.String resourceName,
                         java.lang.String fname)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Copy a file from class/jar to file.
        Parameters:
        c -
        resourceName - class path name for file to read
        fname - file name to save as
        estimatedSize -
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if resource did not exist
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • readResourceTextFile

        public static java.lang.String[] readResourceTextFile(java.lang.Class c,
                                      java.lang.String resourceName)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Read the contents of a text file from a specific class location. This will read from a jar file.
        Parameters:
        fname - '/' seperated file name, located from the class. If fname begins with '/' then the file will go to the root directory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
